page.title: 19Special Needs, Carlton
page.content: St. Margaret's School (Bedfordshire Education Service) moved to Carlton from Great Gaddesdon in 1984. The 8 staff, Headmaster,5 class teachers and 2 specialist teachers cater for children aged from 9-16 with moderate learning difficulties. 60 children are accommodated in the 3 residential blocks. There are 48 on the roll all residential except 5 day children. Children are taught in 5 small classes (around 9 per class). Attention is particularly paid to their individual needs. Emphasis is on language and number skills to provide them with a sufficent degree of independance after laeving school. Leisure activities include; swimming, Cubs, Guides, summer camp, squash and horse riding.
